title:
A Systematic Review on the Potential of AI and ChatGPT for Parental
  Support and Child Well-Being
abstract:
This research article explores the potential of Artificial Intelligence (AI)
and Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformers (ChatGPT) in revolutionizing the
landscape of parental support and child care. With the advancement of
generative AI, conversational agent technology, and Large Language Models,
these tools can be a great support for parents to guide and assist their
children. Recognizing the challenges faced by parents in navigating the
complexities of child-rearing, this study seeks to explore the applications of
AI, particularly leveraging the capabilities of ChatGPT, to provide valuable
assistance and guidance. For this purpose, we perform a comprehensive
examination of the existing 27 literature studies to investigate the potential
of AI-driven platforms for offering advice tailored to the individual needs of
the parents. We break down these research works into three domains based on
their research criteria, and categorize each domain into two subgroups:
pre-chatGPT era, and post-chatGPT era. At last, we investigate the significant
dimensions of these literatures and present some valuable findings and future
research directions.
